items.question: How can I prolong the life of my furniture?
items.answer: Where possible, we recommend storing your furniture indoors during winter (such as inside a shed or outbuilding) to protect it from any harsh weather. If this is not possible, we advise using a protective furniture cover and storing any cushions inside.

items.question: How long does polyrattan furniture last?
items.answer: Polyrattan garden furniture can last as much as 20 years outdoors, even if left out all winter.

items.question: Can I leave my polyrattan furniture outside during winter?
items.answer: While our polyrattan furniture sets can be kept outside all year, we would still advise you to store it indoors where possible, or cover it with a breathable cover in order to maintain the condition of your furniture for as long as possible. If covering your furniture, it is also a good idea to move it and clean the area underneath every few months in order to prevent any buildup of dirt.

items.question: How do I clean polyrattan garden furniture?
items.answer: Simply fill a bucket of lukewarm, soapy water and use a soft sponge or cloth to gently clean your furniture, before washing off any soap with cold water. Remove cushions before cleaning and do not use a pressure washer as this can damage the material. We do not recommend using any abrasive, chemical cleaning products on your furniture unless recommended by a professional.

items.question: Can I leave my cushions outside?
items.answer: Although using a furniture cover or outdoor storage box can provide a level of protection, we always recommend removing cushions and storing them indoors during the winter or any harsh weather spells in order to maintain their condition as well as possible.

items.question: Can I machine wash my cushions?
items.answer: We advise handwashing olefin cushions by rinsing them in a bowl of warm, soapy water and then a bowl of plain water. Machine washing is at the customer's discretion and would need to be done on a very gentle cycle to avoid the risk of shrinkage or distortion. MINT cannot accept responsibility for damage caused by machine washing cushions.
